userStories.question: Besides medications, what else has worked for you?
userStories.tip: Eltroxin

userStories.question: What tip would you give someone like me who was just diagnosed?
userStories.tip: Keep adjusting your medication until you get the right dose.  It's annoying to keep doing blood tests but it's worth it

condition.description:
Your thyroid is a butterfly-shaped gland in your neck, just above your collarbone. It is one of your endocrine glands, which make hormones. Thyroid hormones control the rate of many activities in your body. These include how fast you burn calories and how fast your heart beats. All of these activities are your body's metabolism. If your thyroid gland is not active enough, it does not make enough thyroid hormone to meet your body's needs. This condition is hypothyroidism.

Hypothyroidism is more common in women, people with other thyroid problems, and those over 60 years old. Hashimoto's disease, an autoimmune disorder, is the most common cause. Other causes include thyroid nodules, thyroiditis, congenital hypothyroidism, surgical removal of part or all of the thyroid, radiation treatment of the thyroid, and some medicines.

The symptoms can vary from person to person. They may include

  • Fatigue
  • Weight gain
  • A puffy face
  • Cold intolerance
  • Joint and muscle pain
  • Constipation
  • Dry skin
  • Dry, thinning hair
  • Decreased sweating
  • Heavy or irregular menstrual periods and fertility problems
  • Depression
  • Slowed heart rate

To diagnose hypothyroidism, your doctor will look at your symptoms and blood tests. Treatment is with synthetic thyroid hormone, taken every day.

NIH: National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases
condition.name: Hypothyroidism
symptoms: Heavy or irregular menstrual periods and fertility problems

carousel_items: Take at the same time every day.
Space out colestipol or cholestyramine by at least 4 hours.

clock.tip: Take in the morning on an empty stomach before breakfast.

basics.benefits_moa: Thyroid hormone is a hormone replacement medicine for people with hypothyroidism. Thyroid hormone regulates metabolism, which is everything your body does to turn food into energy. It affects almost every cell in your body.
basics.bottom_line: Thyroid hormone can be used to treat low thyroid hormone, but it's not recommended by most doctors and isn't available in generic.
downsides: Not recommended by doctors because of the inconsistency of thyroid hormone in each tablets, and the fact that it hasn't been studied as much as similar medications.

downsides_processed.orig: Not recommended by doctors because of the inconsistency of thyroid hormone in each tablets, and the fact that it hasn't been studied as much as similar medications.

upsides: Made from animal sources (pigs), so it's considered natural.

upsides_processed.orig: Made from animal sources (pigs), so it's considered natural.

userStories.tip: When I first stated taking Armour Thyroid it was effective in alleviating my hypothyroidism symptoms. After several years, it seems to have stopped working as my symptoms returned. Ironically when I stopped taking it my symptoms improved.

userStories.identifier: Senior Citizen who walks 2 miles a day.
userStories.tip: I took it for years before my Doc put me on levoxyl.  Just persuaded her to let me take natural thyroid again.  I feel so much better on Armour .
Best taken first thing in the morning right after you wake up. It's not to be taken within an hour of any food intake, so the amount of time you take to get ready will be the best buffer.
No problems taking it about an hour before getting up in the morning, but the results overall were not great.  I took it for five months without much success.
Stay away from dairy for a few hours in the morning.  Better effects.
Works well, heard don't combine with dairy

drugs.name: Armour thyroid

carousel_items_processed.orig: Take at the same time every day.
Space out colestipol or cholestyramine by at least 4 hours.

risks_warnings.title: Overdose of thyroid hormone
risks_warnings.description: It is not recommended to take Thyroid hormone for weight loss if your thyroid is working normally. You can get an overdose of thyroid hormone, which can be toxic or even deadly, especially if you are on other medications for losing weight. Talk to your doctor for suggestions to lose weight safely. Symptoms of increased thyroid hormone include irregular heartbeat, tremors, insomnia, vomiting or restlessness.
risk_factors: Taking Thyroid hormone for weight loss

You can get an overdose of thyroid hormone, which can be toxic or even deadly, especially if you are on other medications for losing weight. Talk to your doctor for suggestions to lose weight safely. Symptoms of increased thyroid hormone include irregular heartbeat, tremors, insomnia, vomiting or restlessness.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in blood sugar
risks_warnings.description: People on Thyroid hormone who are diabetic and need medications to control their blood sugar may need to have their doses adjusted. Talk to your doctor if this is a concern.

description_processed.orig: People on Thyroid hormone who are diabetic and need medications to control their blood sugar may need to have their doses adjusted. Talk to your doctor if this is a concern.

risks_warnings.title: Changes in clotting
risks_warnings.description: People on Thyroid hormone who are also taking blood thinners may need to adjust their medications. Your doctor will run blood tests to see if this is needed.

description_processed.orig: People on Thyroid hormone who are also taking blood thinners may need to adjust their medications. Your doctor will run blood tests to see if this is needed.

carousel_items: Full effects may take a few weeks. Continue taking Cytomel even if you don't feel better right away. Talk to your doctor before making any changes.
You'll need blood tests to see if you're on the right dose of Cytomel. Your doctor may adjust your dose every 1 to 2 weeks.
Taking calcium with Cytomel may lower your thyroid hormones. If you take calcium, separate taking it and Cytomel by at least 4 hours.
Try to take Cytomel at the same time each day.

basics.benefits_moa: Cytomel is a synthetic form of thyroid hormone. The thyroid gland makes hormones that are important for body metabolism, growth, and development.
basics.bottom_line: Cytomel is good for treating low thyroid, but you may need frequent blood tests and you should take it exactly as told by your doctor and pharmacist.
downsides: You may need frequent dose adjustments when you first start taking Cytomel or if your health changes.
Periodic blood tests are needed to make sure you're getting the right dose.
Cytomel supplies one type of thyroid hormone, which may not be right for everyone.
Cytomel has many food and drug interactions. Talk to your doctor or pharmacist before you make any changes or start a new medicine.

downsides_processed.orig: You may need frequent dose adjustments when you first start taking Cytomel or if your health changes.

userStories.tip: I take a compounded time-release version of this, in addition to levothyroxine. It turns out that I've been anemic, so I'm hoping when that resolves I'll be able to go back to just levothyroxine alone.
Take in the morning, no calcium or iron products within 4 hours.

drugs.name: Cytomel

carousel_items_processed.orig: Full effects may take a few weeks. Continue taking Cytomel even if you don't feel better right away. Talk to your doctor before making any changes.
You'll need blood tests to see if you're on the right dose of Cytomel. Your doctor may adjust your dose every 1 to 2 weeks.
Taking calcium with Cytomel may lower your thyroid hormones. If you take calcium, separate taking it and Cytomel by at least 4 hours.
Try to take Cytomel at the same time each day.

risks_warnings.title: Weight reduction
risks_warnings.description: Don't take Cytomel for weight loss or obesity. It’s not recommended, safe or effective for this use, especially if you don't have problems with your thyroid. Taking high doses of Cytomel can cause serious effects, especially if used with other medications for weight loss. Talk to your doctor about other medicines you can take to treat your condition.

description_processed.orig: Don't take Cytomel for weight loss or obesity. It’s not recommended, safe or effective for this use, especially if you don't have problems with your thyroid. Taking high doses of Cytomel can cause serious effects, especially if used with other medications for weight loss. Talk to your doctor about other medicines you can take to treat your condition.

risks_warnings.title: Lack of adrenal function
risks_warnings.description: Low thyroid can be the result of other hormonal conditions. If you have an adrenal condition, your doctor will decide if you need to be treated for other conditions before taking Cytomel.

description_processed.orig: Low thyroid can be the result of other hormonal conditions. If you have an adrenal condition, your doctor will decide if you need to be treated for other conditions before taking Cytomel.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking Cytomel can cause new or worsen heart problems. Call your doctor or get medical care right away if you have rapid or irregular heartbeats, chest pain or shortness of breath. These symptoms may be serious and due to overtreatment of Cytomel. You may need to stop taking your medicine for one week, then re-start at a lower dose.
risk_factors: Taking Cytomel with certain types of stimulant medicines

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: Many medicines interact with Cytomel. You may need your dose adjusted, especially if they are "narrow" therapy medicines like warfarin. Let your doctor and pharmacist know if you are taking any new prescriptions or over-the-counter medicines.

description_processed.orig: Many medicines interact with Cytomel. You may need your dose adjusted, especially if they are "narrow" therapy medicines like warfarin. Let your doctor and pharmacist know if you are taking any new prescriptions or over-the-counter medicines.

carousel_items: This is one of the few drugs where the brand really does work better than the generic for some people.

Food prevents Levothyroxine absorption. Take it on an empty stomach with a full glass of water at least 30 minutes before breakfast and other medicines. If this is too much of a hassle for you and you end up skipping your medicine, it's better to just take it whenever you want, and your doctor can increase the dose if needed.
Separate by at least 4 hours from any antacids, calcium or iron supplements, and multivitamins.
Starts working in 1 to 2 weeks. Full effects in 6 to 8 weeks.
Can cause irregular heart rate, anxiety, sweating, or trouble sleeping until your body gets used to the medicine. Side effects might not go away if the dose is too high for you.
Not all generics and brands are the same. Double-check with your pharmacist that you have the right medicine for you.

clock.tip: Works quicker when taken without food.

basics.benefits_moa: Levothyroxine is a synthetic version of a hormone made by your thyroid gland. Thyroid hormones affect many important bodily functions, like controlling metabolism and telling your body how to use energy sources.
basics.bottom_line: Levothyroxine is an important replacement hormone when your body can't make enough thyroid hormone. It's easily affected by food, other medicines or supplements, and health conditions, so you should try to take it exactly as instructed.
downsides: Absorption is easily affected by food and other medicines.
Not one-dose-fits-all: Dose adjustments are usually needed when starting the medicine and when your health changes.
Routine blood tests are needed at least yearly and more during dose adjustments, but it takes a long time to see full effect (6 to 8 weeks).

Different brands of Levothyroxine may not work the same. Ask your pharmacist if your refill looks different than your old pills. Synthroid is one of the few drugs where the brand really does work better than the generic for many people.
Lots of drug interactions, so check with your pharmacist before taking anything new.

downsides_processed.orig: Absorption is easily affected by food and other medicines.
Not one-dose-fits-all: Dose adjustments are usually needed when starting the medicine and when your health changes.
Routine blood tests are needed at least yearly and more during dose adjustments, but it takes a long time to see full effect (6 to 8 weeks).

Different brands of Levothyroxine may not work the same. Ask your pharmacist if your refill looks different than your old pills. Synthroid is one of the few drugs where the brand really does work better than the generic for many people.
Lots of drug interactions, so check with your pharmacist before taking anything new.

upsides: Supplies an essential hormone that your body needs to function. Works well to improve symptoms of an underactive thyroid.
Safe to use for any age range and pregnant women.

upsides_processed.orig: Supplies an essential hormone that your body needs to function. Works well to improve symptoms of an underactive thyroid.
Safe to use for any age range and pregnant women.

userStories.tip: Take it every single day!
Most important....a good endocrinologist.  Mine got the right medicine at the right dosage from the start.  Manages adjustments as needed. Never had problems.
I take if very early in AM before getting out of bed.  I put one pill on top of the bottle the night before so there's no problems that early in day and I've never missed a dose..

userStories.identifier: Mom, works full time and is hypothyroid.
userStories.tip: I had tremendous anxiety for 48 hours before my period.  I could not concentrate was afraid to drive and could not work.  After 2 months I demanded a change to Armour.

userStories.identifier: I am a 74 year old female
userStories.tip: After many years of taking 50 mcg. daily of this drug, I developed a severe allergic reaction.  I actually felt so ill that I thought that I had a terminal illness and was going to die.  Very bad stuff!  I don't know if they changed the fillers or formula as they have in the past.  There have been reports of problems when that occurred.  All I know is I will never, ever take Synthroid or similar drugs again.  Who wants to have flaking, inflamed eyelids, shortness of breath and problems with joints and muscles.  Couple this with overwhelming fatigue and you have a recipe for disaster.
Get an adjustment in dosage after you start.
It's not a joke. It's important you don't forget to take it. No taking it as you should can have serious effects on you.

The generic worked fine for me for probably 8 years but the last 2 have been awful -- terrible weight gain, depression, constipation. Blood work shows it's working just right but clearly something is wrong.
It takes time to take effect & the weight gained because of a slow thyroid did not just fall off-took me 5 years to lose.
Thinning of hair , brittle nails
Calcium and fiber restrictions need to be addressed when Rx is given. I found out how it impacts absorption through my own research.

The generic version of this medicine did not work at all, I switched to the brand name and it works better for me. I also started taking mine at night and have found the absorption and effectiveness increased significantly.
There is a big difference between the generic and brand name medication

userStories.identifier: 47 yr old Female thyroid issues for 30 y

userStories.tip: Be careful when your doctor adjusts your dosages. A tiny change can make a *huge* difference. Don't let them change your levels too quickly.

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: I had to take the generic form of the medication in order to show how it did not work for me. I felt horrible on this medication, lethargic, depressed, it was a challenge. Just didn't work for me. I am one of the few who needs brand name.
I would give up a meal in order to get my prescription filled - effects of hypothyroid condition too miserable to consider doing without this drug.
If you are taking it while pregnant get tested monthly, even in the last stages of pregnancy, and make sure all results are sent to your specialist.
Talk to your doctor if you still feel sluggish at your dose. It took me a while to get mine right, but I have been ok and weight-stable etc for years now.
My asymptomatic Hashimoto's (hypothyroidism) was diagnosed while troubleshooting fertility problems.  I got pregnant immediately after I started taking levothyroxine.
My asymptomatic Hashimoto's (hypothyroidism) was diagnosed while troubleshooting fertility problems.  I got pregnant immediately after I started taking levothyroxine.

Having to take it early, before  coffee or breakfast, is inconvenient, but totally worth it when you get your energy back. Also, I found that it didn't work nearly as well for me till I started regulating my blood sugar through better diet choices.  I don't feel hypo any more!
userStories.identifier: Young, educated mom of 3 active kids

userStories.satisfaction: Not worth it, thinking about stopping
userStories.tip: I dont feel any different, only my blood results shows its impact
If you're pregnant your dose will most likely increase so make sure to meet with your endo monthly
No issues, would prefer not to take. But not an option.

Food prevents Levothyroxine absorption. Take it on an empty stomach with a full glass of water at least 30 minutes before breakfast and other medicines. If this is too much of a hassle for you and you end up skipping your medicine, it's better to just take it whenever you want, and your doctor can increase the dose if needed.
Separate by at least 4 hours from any antacids, calcium or iron supplements, and multivitamins.
Starts working in 1 to 2 weeks. Full effects in 6 to 8 weeks.
Can cause irregular heart rate, anxiety, sweating, or trouble sleeping until your body gets used to the medicine. Side effects might not go away if the dose is too high for you.
Not all generics and brands are the same. Double-check with your pharmacist that you have the right medicine for you.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Taking Levothyroxine can cause new or worsen heart problems. Call your doctor or get medical care right away if you have rapid or irregular heartbeats, chest pain or shortness of breath. These symptoms may be serious and due to overtreatment of Levothyroxine. You may need to stop taking your medicine for one week, then re-start at a lower dose.
risk_factors: Taking Levothyroxine with certain types of stimulant medicines

description_processed.orig: Taking Levothyroxine can cause new or worsen heart problems. Call your doctor or get medical care right away if you have rapid or irregular heartbeats, chest pain or shortness of breath. These symptoms may be serious and due to overtreatment of Levothyroxine. You may need to stop taking your medicine for one week, then re-start at a lower dose.

risks_warnings.title: Weight reduction
risks_warnings.description: don't take Levothyroxine for weight loss or obesity.  It’s not recommended, safe or effective for this use, especially if you don't have any issues with your thyroid. Taking high doses of Levothyroxine can cause serious or fatal effects especially if used with other medications for weight loss.  Talk to your doctor before about other medicines you can take to treat your condition.

description_processed.orig: don't take Levothyroxine for weight loss or obesity.  It’s not recommended, safe or effective for this use, especially if you don't have any issues with your thyroid. Taking high doses of Levothyroxine can cause serious or fatal effects especially if used with other medications for weight loss.  Talk to your doctor before about other medicines you can take to treat your condition.

risks_warnings.title: Drug interactions
risks_warnings.description: Many medicines interact with Levothyroxine. You may need your dose adjusted, especially if they are "narrow" therapy medicines like warfarin. Let your doctor and pharmacist know if you are taking any new prescriptions or over-the-counter medicines.

description_processed.orig: Many medicines interact with Levothyroxine. You may need your dose adjusted, especially if they are "narrow" therapy medicines like warfarin. Let your doctor and pharmacist know if you are taking any new prescriptions or over-the-counter medicines.

risks_warnings.title: Bone effects
risks_warnings.description: Levothyroxine can thin the bones. Using the lowest possible dose to treat your condition will reduce this risk.

description_processed.orig: Levothyroxine can thin the bones. Using the lowest possible dose to treat your condition will reduce this risk.

risks_warnings.title: Lack of adrenal function
risks_warnings.description: Low thyroid can be the result of other hormonal conditions. Autoimmune thyroid disease, low hypothalamus/adrenal function, type-1 diabetes, and pernicious anemia, from vitamin B12 deficiency. If you have an adrenal condition, your doctor will decide if you need to be treated for other conditions before taking Levothyroxine.

description_processed.orig: Low thyroid can be the result of other hormonal conditions. Autoimmune thyroid disease, low hypothalamus/adrenal function, type-1 diabetes, and pernicious anemia, from vitamin B12 deficiency. If you have an adrenal condition, your doctor will decide if you need to be treated for other conditions before taking Levothyroxine.
